back_cards.definition_en: The use of violence to create fear
back_cards.example_en: The government condemned acts of terrorism.

back_cards.definition_en: A method to achieve political goals
back_cards.example_en: Terrorism disrupted the peace talks.
The city was on alert due to terrorism.
They fought against global terrorism.
Terrorism affected the region’s stability.
The respondent provided honest feedback.
She was a respondent in the poll.
The respondent shared their opinion.

back_cards.definition_en: A person in a legal case
back_cards.example_en: The respondent defended their position.
Each respondent completed the form.

back_cards.definition_en: A person who tells a story
back_cards.example_en: The narrator described the scene vividly.

back_cards.definition_en: A voice in a film or book
back_cards.example_en: The narrator guided the audience through the plot.
The narrator shared a personal memory.
The novel’s narrator was unreliable.
The narrator’s voice was calm and clear.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of casting a vote
back_cards.example_en: Voting took place at the local school.
She encouraged everyone to join in voting.
Voting for the mayor was close.
Voting determines the new leader.
Young people were active in voting.
The refugee sought safety in a new country.
The camp housed thousands of refugees.
The refugee shared their story.
Refugees arrived after the war.
The refugee family rebuilt their lives.
The assembly met to discuss policies.
The state assembly passed a new law.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of putting parts together
back_cards.example_en: The assembly of the machine took hours.
The assembly included a guest speaker.
The workers held an assembly.
The company was accused of fraud.
He fell victim to online fraud.
The fraud cost investors millions.
The contract was based on fraud.
She reported the fraud to the police.
The project faced a time limitation.
Her skills had no limitation.
The device’s limitation was its battery.
The law set a limitation on spending.
Budget limitations delayed the plan.
The partnership launched a new product.
Their partnership improved the project.
The partnership built a community center.
The partnership benefited both companies.
Their partnership led to success.
The car crashed into a tree.
The website crashed during the sale.
The waves crashed against the shore.
The stock market crashed last week.
He crashed the party uninvited.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of standing for something
back_cards.example_en: She ensured fair representation in the meeting.
The painting is a representation of nature.
The lawyer provided representation in court.
The statue is a representation of freedom.
The group demanded better representation.
The ministry of health issued a statement.
He joined a ministry to help the poor.
The ministry approved the new policy.
The ministry organized a charity event.
She works for the ministry of education.
The flat surface was perfect for writing.
The party felt flat without music.
The flat landscape stretched for miles.
The soda went flat after hours.
She paid a flat fee for the service.
Her wise decision saved the project.
The wise elder shared valuable advice.
It was wise to save money early.
His wise choice avoided trouble.
The wise strategy won the game.
She registered for the art class.
He registered his new car.
Her face registered surprise.
They registered the votes carefully.
He didn’t register the warning.
The comedy made everyone laugh.
She prefers comedy over drama.
The mix-up was like a comedy.

back_cards.definition_en: A play or movie with humor
back_cards.example_en: The comedy won an award.
His speech had touches of comedy.
She tapped his shoulder to get attention.
They tapped the keg for the party.
He tapped the nail into the wood.
She tapped into her savings.
They tapped the phone line.
The city improved its infrastructure.
Roads are part of the infrastructure.
The infrastructure supports the economy.
The company upgraded its IT infrastructure.
The storm damaged the infrastructure.
She buys organic vegetables.
The soil was rich in organic material.
The organic skincare line was popular.
The team’s organic growth was steady.
Organic compounds were studied in class.
Islam is practiced by millions globally.

back_cards.definition_en: A faith based on the Quran
back_cards.example_en: She studied Islam in college.
Islam emphasizes charity and prayer.
The mosque is a center for Islam.
Islam shares roots with other faiths.
The team had diverse skills.
The festival featured diverse foods.
Their opinions were diverse.
The library had a diverse collection.
The city attracts a diverse crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to the mind or intellect
back_cards.example_en: She enjoyed intellectual debates.
The book was an intellectual challenge.
His approach was highly intellectual.
The lecture was intellectual and engaging.
The game required intellectual skill.
The shirt was too tight for him.
She tied a tight knot.
The deadline was tight.
The game was a tight match.
The parking spot was tight.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for ships to dock
back_cards.example_en: The ship arrived at the port.
The port was busy with cargo.

back_cards.definition_en: A connection point on a device
back_cards.example_en: She plugged the cable into the port.
The port city thrived on trade.
The port handled international goods.
She believed fate brought them together.
His fate was to become a leader.
The battle decided the city’s fate.
Fate led her to a new career.
They accepted their fate calmly.
She had absolute confidence in her plan.
The king had absolute power.
His decision was absolute.
The rule applies in absolute terms.
The silence was absolute in the forest.
The dialogue between them was friendly.
The meeting encouraged open dialogue.

back_cards.definition_en: Lines in a script or play
back_cards.example_en: The movie’s dialogue was witty.
The dialogue led to an agreement.
Her dialogue with the team was clear.
The frequency of storms increased.
The radio operates at a high frequency.
She noted the frequency of his visits.
The frequency of errors was low.
The frequency was adjusted for clarity.
The tribe gathered for a festival.
The tribe preserved its traditions.
She studied the tribe’s history.
The tribe supported its members.
The gaming tribe met online.
The external walls needed repair.
The company hired an external consultant.
External factors affected the project.
The device has an external battery.
External trade boosted the economy.
She made an appointment with the doctor.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of assigning a role
back_cards.example_en: His appointment as manager was announced.
The appointment was set for noon.
Her appointment to the board was historic.
The lawyer confirmed the appointment.

He converted to a new religion.
They converted the garage into an office.

The building was converted into a museum.

The mobile workforce travels often.

Mobile networks improved in the area.
The restaurant is a local establishment.

The establishment served great coffee.
He challenged the political establishment.
The establishment of rules helped order.
She was worried about the exam.
His worried expression was noticeable.
They were worried about the storm.
He felt worried before the speech.
She was worried for her friend’s safety.
She waved and said, ‘Bye!’

back_cards.definition_en: A term to end a conversation
back_cards.example_en: He said bye and hung up.
‘Bye, see you tomorrow!’ she called.
The kids shouted bye as they left.
He whispered bye before leaving.
She went shopping for clothes.
The shopping took all afternoon.
Online shopping is very convenient.
They did their grocery shopping weekly.
Shopping at the mall was fun.
The celebrity signed autographs for fans.
She became a celebrity after the movie.
The celebrity attended the gala.
The celebrity shared their story.

back_cards.definition_en: A star in media or entertainment
back_cards.example_en: The celebrity endorsed the product.

back_cards.definition_en: A member of the U.S. Congress
back_cards.example_en: The congressman voted on the bill.
She met the congressman at a rally.
The congressman spoke about taxes.
The congressman served two terms.
The congressman proposed a new law.
Her speech impressed the audience.

The performance impressed everyone.

back_cards.definition_en: A citizen paying for public services
back_cards.example_en: Taxpayers supported the school budget.
She adapted to the new city quickly.
He adapted the recipe for vegans.
The software was adapted for mobile use.
They adapted to the cold weather.
The book was adapted into a movie.

back_cards.definition_en: In an open or public manner
back_cards.example_en: She spoke publicly about the issue.
The event was publicly announced.

The results were publicly displayed.
The data was publicly available.
She felt pride in her team’s victory.

The award was a point of pride.
Her children were her greatest pride.
The festival was a display of pride.

The store sells trendy clothing.
His clothing was casual and comfortable.
The team wore matching clothing.

back_cards.definition_en: Fabrics used to cover the body
back_cards.example_en: The clothing was made of cotton.
The fire spread rapidly through the forest.
She spoke rapidly during the debate.
The company grew rapidly this year.
Technology is advancing rapidly.
He rapidly finished his homework.

back_cards.definition_en: An area of expertise or control
back_cards.example_en: Science is her domain of study.
The company bought a new domain.
The king ruled over a vast domain.
The issue falls under her domain.
Art is his creative domain.
The event was mainly for students.
She mainly works from home.
The diet consists mainly of vegetables.
The crowd was mainly young people.
The book focuses mainly on history.

back_cards.definition_en: The upper surface of a room
back_cards.example_en: The ceiling was painted white.
The budget hit its ceiling.

back_cards.definition_en: The top of an interior space
back_cards.example_en: A chandelier hung from the ceiling.
The debt ceiling was raised.
Her ambition had no ceiling.
